intro: Lastrea erubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
